Legal_Issue: Whether there is a genuine issue for trial regarding Mr. Kichuk's personal liability for trademark infringement
Evidence_Assessment: Mr. Kichuk conducted a trademark search that did not reveal the 'ISO-FLEX' mark; he had no prior knowledge of the plaintiffs or their products; post-adoption events were considered but found insufficient to establish liability
Decision_Outcome: Summary judgment granted, dismissing claims against Mr. Kichuk and Mr. Glover
Legal_Rule: Directors and officers are personally liable if their conduct is tortious or shows deliberate, willful indifference to the risk of infringement
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged trademark infringement through corporate actions by Mr. Kichuk
Outcome_on_Merits: No genuine issue for trial exists
Key_Evidence_Considered: Trademark search results, lack of prior knowledge of plaintiffs or their marks, timing of adoption of 'ISOFLEX'
Court_Result: Summary judgment in favor of defendants
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence (trademark search), testimonial inference (lack of knowledge)
Governing_Rule: Rule on personal liability of directors and officers in trademark infringement cases
